pageContext.description:
A bust-length portrait of Friedrich III of Saxony facing right, wearing a black cap, a white pleated shirt and doublet with a fur collar. The sitter is shown against a light blue background. Sixteen lines of verse print on paper are stuck to the panel underneath the image, and a piece of paper with letterpress bearing his title is pasted in the top right corner. The woodcut pasted to the back of the panel is a bookplate with the coat-of-arms of the Electors of Saxony by Lucas Cranach and was first used in the Wittenberger Heiligthumsbuch (Wittenberg Reliquary Book). 
[cda 2020]
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 20.5 x 14.3 cm
[Letter from D. Koepplin to Koetser Gallery, Zürich, 18.06.2002; Koepplin Archive]
pageContext.inscription:
Recto: 
- on a separate piece of paper pasted in the upper right corner, three lines of letterpress: 'friderich der Drit / Chur- // furst und herzog zu // Sachssen' 
- beneath the image sixteen lines of letterpress in rhyming couplets: 'fridrich bin ich billich genand ...Von dem nicht wand gonst noch gelt.' 

Verso:
- woodcut bearing the Saxon coat of arms (5 x 4 cm)
